lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/duke.Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run duke.Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
* The class constructor, which utilizes the superclass
* @param description the description of the task
* @param by the deadline of the task
public Deadline(String description, String by) throws DukeException {
throw new DukeException("Invalid Date Format (YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM required).");
* Formats the deadline to be displayed as MONTH DATE YEAR i.e. MARCH 19 2022.
* @return String of the deadline to be displayed.
* Formats and outputs the string representation of a duke.Deadline viable for writing
* @return formatted txt file string representation of a duke.Deadline.
String s = String.format("D | %s | %s | %s\n", super.getStatusIcon(), this.description, this.by.format(format));

* @return formatted txt file string representation of an duke.Event.
String s = String.format("E | %s | %s | %s\n", super.getStatusIcon(), this.description, this.at);

* This is the other half of the decision making tree.

* @param tasks where tasks are to be added.

public void parse(String input) throws DukeException {

* The class constructor for a duke.Task.

* Retrieves the isDone field of a duke.Task and outputs the
* corresponding status icon via a ternary operator.
* @return a "X" or " " if task is completed or not respectively.
return (isDone ? "X" : "O"); // mark done task with X
* Sets the isDone field of a duke.Task to true and outputs the
* corresponding formatted text with the task description.
* @return a String to indicate the task has been marked done.
this.isDone = true; // mark task as true
String result = String.format("Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n%s", this.toString());
* Sets the isDone field of a loaded duke.Task to be true. Mainly used for loading
* tasks from a file. No output to prevent spamming the console.
this.isDone = true; // mark task as true
* Retrieves the description of a task.
return this.description; // get description of task

throw new DukeException("There is no such task!");
